org.typelibrary.binarystrings

Class ByteString

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.typelibrary.binarystrings.ByteString

  • public final class ByteString
extends Object
    Immutable sequence of bytes. Equivalent to java.lang.String but for byte values instead of char. Also takes inspiration from Google Protobuf ByteString.

    Differences with java.lang.String:

    • Doesn't implement Comparable<T>
    • Doesn't implement Serializable
    • Doesn't implement equivalent to CharSequence
    • No equivalent builder classes such as StringBuilder/StringBuffer
    • No intern capability
    • No character/character-string specific methods.
      • codePointAt/Before/Count, offsetByCodePoints
      • copyValueOf (char), valueOf, trim, format
      • toLowerCase/UpperCase/CharArray
      • regex - matches, replaceAll, replaceFirst, split,

    Differences with com.google.protobuf.ByteString

    • Doesn't implement Iterable.
    • Doesn't implement Utf8 convenience methods
    • Doesn't support CodedInputStream
    • Doesn't implement Rope based ByteString.
      • Rope based ByteString has roughly O(1) vs. O(n) performance for concatenation, OutputStream (which concatenates writes) and certain other operations.

    • Method Detail

      • byteAt

        public byte byteAt(int index)
        Returns the byte value at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to length() - 1. The first byte value of the sequence is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as for array indexing.

        (This description from String.charAt)

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte value
        Returns:
        the byte value at the specified index of this string. The first byte value is at index 0.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index argument is negative or not less than the length of this string.
        See Also:
        String.charAt(int)

      • concat

        public ByteString concat(byte[] source)
        Concatenates the specified byte array to the end of this string.

        If the length of the string is 0, then this ByteString object is returned. Otherwise, a new ByteString object is created, representing a byte sequence that is the concatenation of the byte sequence represented by this ByteString object and the byte sequence represented by the argument byte array.

        (This description from String.concat)

        Parameters:
        source - The byte array that is to be concatenated to the end of this string.
        Returns:
        a string that represents the concatenation of this object's bytes followed by the string argument's bytes.
        See Also:
        String.concat(java.lang.String)

      • concat

        public ByteString concat(byte[] source,
                int offset,
                int length)
        Concatenates the specified byte array to the end of this string.

        If the length of the string is 0, then this ByteString object is returned. Otherwise, a new ByteString object is created, representing a byte sequence that is the concatenation of the byte sequence represented by this ByteString object and the byte sequence represented by the argument byte array.

        (This description from String.concat)

        Parameters:
        source - The byte array that is to be concatenated to the end of this string.
        offset - The index of the first byte to be concatenated
        length - The number of bytes to concatenate
        Returns:
        a string that represents the concatenation of this object's bytes followed by the string argument's bytes.
        See Also:
        String.concat(java.lang.String)

      • concat

        public ByteString concat(ByteString... strings)
        Concatenates the specified strings to the end of this string.

        If the length of the argument string is 0, then this ByteString object is returned. Otherwise, a new ByteString object is created, representing a byte sequence that is the concatenation of the byte sequence represented by this ByteString object and the byte sequence represented by the argument strings.

        (This description from String.concat)

        This method differs from String in that it allows you to concatenate multiple strings at once. This is more efficient since intermediate strings are not created during concatenation.

        Parameters:
        strings - the ByteStrings that are to be concatenated to the end of this string.
        Returns:
        a string that represents the concatenation of this object's bytes followed by the string argument's bytes.
        See Also:
        String.concat(java.lang.String)

        Returns:
        true if the byte sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the byte sequence represented by this object; false otherwise. Note that the result will be true if the argument is the empty string or is equal to this ByteString object as determined by the equals(java.lang.Object) method.

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Compares this string to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a ByteString object that represents the same sequence of bytes as this object.

        (This description from String.equals)

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte value)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified byte.

        If a byte with value value occurs in the byte sequence represented by this ByteString object, then the index of the first such occurrence is returned. This is the smallest value k such that:

        this.byteAt(k) == value

        If no such value occurs in this string, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.indexOf)

        Parameters:
        value - a byte value
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the byte in the byte sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the byte does not occur.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte value,
          int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified byte, starting the search at the specified index.

        If a byte with value value occurs in the byte sequence represented by this ByteString object, then the index of the first such occurrence is returned. This is the smallest value k such that:

        (this.charAt(k) == value) && (k >= fromIndex)

        If no such value occurs in this string, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.indexOf)

        Parameters:
        value - a byte value
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the byte in the byte sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the byte does not occur.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(ByteString string)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified substring.

        The returned index is the smallest value k for which:

        this.startsWith(string, k)

        If no such value of k exists, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        string - the substring to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the specified substring, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(ByteString string,
          int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified substring, starting the search at the specified index.

        The returned index is the smallest value k for which:

        k >= fromIndex && this.startsWith(string, k)

        If no such value of k exists, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        string - the substring to search for
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the specified substring, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified byte array.

        The returned index is the smallest value k for which:

        this.startsWith(bytes, k)

        If no such value of k exists, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte array, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte[] bytes,
          int offset,
          int length,
          int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified byte array, starting the search at the specified index.

        The returned index is the smallest value k for which:

        k >= fromIndex && this.startsWith(bytes, offset, length, k)

        If no such value of k exists, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to search for
        offset - the index of the first byte to search for
        length - the number of bytes to search for
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte array, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if, and only if, length() is 0.
        Returns:
        true is length() is 0, otherwise false.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte value)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified byte. The index returned is the largest value k such that:

        this.byteAt(k) == value

        If no such value occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The ByteString is searched backwards starting at the last character.

        (This description from String.indexOf)

        Parameters:
        value - a byte value
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the byte in the byte sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the byte does not occur.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte value,
              int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified byte, searching backwards starting at the specified index. The index returned is the largest value k such that:

        (this.charAt(k) == value) && (k <= fromIndex)

        If no such value occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The ByteString is searched backwards starting at the last character.

        (This description from String.indexOf)

        Parameters:
        value - a byte value
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from. There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is greater than or equal to the length of this string, it has the same effect as if it were equal to one less than the length of this string: this entire string may be searched. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were -1: -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the byte in the byte sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the byte does not occur.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(ByteString string)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified substring. The last occurrence of the empty string is considered to occur at the index value this.length().

        The index returned is the largest value k such that:

        this.startsWith(string, k)

        If no such value k exists, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.lastIndexOf)

        Parameters:
        string - the substring to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the specified substring, or -1 if there is no such occrrence.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(ByteString string,
              int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified substring, searching backwards starting at the specified index.

        The returned index is the largest value k for which:

        k <= fromIndex && this.startsWith(string, k)

        If no such value k exists, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.lastIndexOf)

        Parameters:
        string - the substring to search for
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the specified substring, searching backwards from the specified index, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified byte array. The last occurrence of the empty byte array is considered to occur at the index value this.length().

        The index returned is the largest value k such that:

        this.startsWith(string, k)

        If no such value k exists, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.lastIndexOf)

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte array, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte[] bytes,
              int offset,
              int length,
              int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified byte array, searching backwards starting at the specified index.

        The returned index is the largest value k for which:

        k <= fromIndex && this.startsWith(bytes, offset, length, k)

        If no such value k exists, then -1 is returned.

        (This description from String.lastIndexOf)

        Parameters:
        bytes - the substring to search for
        offset - the index of the first byte to search for
        length - the number of bytes to search for
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the specified substring, searching backwards from the specified index, or -1 if there is no such occurrence.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of this string. The length is equal to the number of bytes in the string.
        Returns:
        the length of the sequence of bytes represented by this object.

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(ByteString prefix)
        Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.

        (This description from String.startsWith)

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the byte sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the byte sequence represented by this string; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this ByteString object as determined by the equals(Object) method.

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(ByteString prefix,
                 int toffset)
        Tests if the substring of this string beginning at the specified index starts with the specified prefix.

        (This description from String.startsWith)

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the byte sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the substring of this object starting at index toffset; false otherwise. The result is false if toffset is negative or greater than the length of this ByteString object; otherwise the result is the same as the result of the expression

        this.substring(toffset).startsWith(prefix)

      • substring

        public ByteString substring(int beginIndex)
        Returns a new string that is a substring of this string. The substring begins with the byte at the specified index and extends to the end of this string.

        (This description from String.substring)

        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        Returns:
        the specified substring
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if beginIndex is negative or larger than the length of this String object.

      • substring

        public ByteString substring(int beginIndex,
                   int endIndex)
        Returns a new string that is a substring of this string. The substring begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the byte at index endIndex - 1. Thus the length of the substring is endIndex - beginIndex.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the spedcified substring
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the beginIndex is negative, or endIndex is larger than the length of this String object, or beginIndex is larger than endIndex.
